snippet: In recent days, jihadists have killed more than 300 people in Turkey, Bangladesh, Iraq and Saudi Arabia, and many Westerners have responded with relative indifference....
abstract: Many Muslims around globe express concern over seeming Western indifference to terrorist attacks in Muslim nations, compared to outrage over massacres committed by same militant groups in Paris and Brussels; worry goals of Islamic State and other radical groups are reinforced by perception that non-Western lives are less significant.

byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Paris, and Karen Zraick from New York.

lead_paragraph: In recent days, jihadists have killed more than 300 people in Turkey, Bangladesh, Iraq and Saudi Arabia, and many Westerners have responded with relative indifference.

headline.main: After Attacks on Muslims, Many Ask: Where Is the Outpouring?
headline.print_headline: Muslims Stung by Indifference to Their Losses

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
